controllers.smc.algorithms.classical.controllerÂ¶

Source: src\controllers\smc\algorithms\classical\controller.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Modular Classical SMC Controller.

Clean implementation using focused components:

  • SlidingSurface: Surface computation

  • EquivalentControl: Model-based feedforward

  • BoundaryLayer: Chattering reduction

  • Configuration: Type-safe parameters

Replaces the monolithic 458-line controller with composition of 50-100 line modules.

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#=============== src/controllers/smc/algorithms/classical/controller.py ===============\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Modular Classical SMC Controller.
  7
  8Clean implementation using focused components:
  9- SlidingSurface: Surface computation
 10- EquivalentControl: Model-based feedforward
 11- BoundaryLayer: Chattering reduction
 12- Configuration: Type-safe parameters
 13
 14Replaces the monolithic 458-line controller with composition of 50-100 line modules.
 15"""
 16
 17from typing import Dict, List, Union, Optional, Any
 18import numpy as np
 19import logging
 20
 21from ...core.sliding_surface import LinearSlidingSurface
 22from ...core.equivalent_control import EquivalentControl
 23from .boundary_layer import BoundaryLayer
 24from .config import ClassicalSMCConfig
 25
 26
 27class ModularClassicalSMC:
 28    """
 29    Modular Classical SMC controller using composition of focused components.
 30
 31    Components:
 32    - Sliding surface: Computes s = Î»â‚Ä—â‚ + câ‚eâ‚ + Î»â‚‚Ä—â‚‚ + câ‚‚eâ‚‚
 33    - Equivalent control: Model-based u_eq = -(LMâ»Â¹B)â»Â¹LMâ»Â¹F
 34    - Boundary layer: Continuous switching with chattering reduction
 35    """
 36
 37    # Required for PSO optimization integration
 38    n_gains = 6  # [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, K, kd]
 39
 40    def __init__(self, config: ClassicalSMCConfig):
 41        """
 42        Initialize modular classical SMC.
 43
 44        Args:
 45            config: Type-safe configuration object
 46        """
 47        self.config = config
 48
 49        # Initialize components
 50        self._surface = LinearSlidingSurface(config.get_surface_gains())
 51        self._equivalent = EquivalentControl(
 52            dynamics_model=config.dynamics_model,
 53            regularization_alpha=config.regularization_alpha,
 54            min_regularization=config.min_regularization,
 55            max_condition_number=config.max_condition_number,
 56            use_fixed_regularization=not config.use_adaptive_regularization,
 57            controllability_threshold=config.get_effective_controllability_threshold()
 58        )
 59        self._boundary_layer = BoundaryLayer(
 60            thickness=config.boundary_layer,
 61            slope=config.boundary_layer_slope,
 62            switch_method=config.switch_method
 63        )
 64
 65        # Setup logging
 66        self.logger = logging.getLogger(self.__class__.__name__)
 67
 68    def compute_control(self, state: np.ndarray, state_vars: Any, history: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 69        """
 70        Compute classical SMC control law.
 71
 72        Args:
 73            state: System state [x, x_dot, theta1, theta1_dot, theta2, theta2_dot]
 74            state_vars: Controller internal state (for interface compatibility)
 75            history: Controller history (for interface compatibility)
 76
 77        Returns:
 78            Control result dictionary
 79        """
 80        try:
 81            # 1. Compute sliding surface
 82            surface_value = self._surface.compute(state)
 83
 84            # 2. Compute surface derivative (simplified)
 85            surface_derivative = self._estimate_surface_derivative(state)
 86
 87            # 3. Compute equivalent control (model-based feedforward)
 88            u_equivalent = self._equivalent.compute(state, self._surface, surface_derivative)
 89
 90            # 4. Compute switching control (robust feedback)
 91            u_switching = self._boundary_layer.compute_switching_control(
 92                surface_value, self.config.K, surface_derivative
 93            )
 94
 95            # 5. Compute derivative control (damping)
 96            u_derivative = self.config.kd * surface_derivative
 97
 98            # 6. Combine control components
 99            u_total = u_equivalent + u_switching + u_derivative
100
101            # 7. Apply saturation
102            u_saturated = np.clip(u_total, -self.config.max_force, self.config.max_force)
103
104            # 8. Create result
105            return self._create_control_result(
106                u_saturated, surface_value, surface_derivative,
107                u_equivalent, u_switching, u_derivative, u_total
108            )
109
110        except Exception as e:
111            self.logger.error(f"Control computation failed: {e}")
112            return self._create_error_result(str(e))
113
114    def _estimate_surface_derivative(self, state: np.ndarray) -> float:
115        """Estimate surface derivative for derivative control."""
116        # Simplified derivative estimation
117        # In full implementation, this would use dynamics model
118        if len(state) >= 6:
119            theta1_dot = state[3]
120            theta2_dot = state[5]
121            return self.config.lam1 * theta1_dot + self.config.lam2 * theta2_dot
122        return 0.0
123
124    def _create_control_result(self, u_final: float, surface_value: float,
125                             surface_derivative: float, u_eq: float,
126                             u_switch: float, u_deriv: float, u_total: float) -> Dict[str, Any]:
127        """Create structured control result."""
128        return {
129            # Main output
130            'u': float(u_final),
131
132            # Component breakdown
133            'surface_value': float(surface_value),
134            'surface_derivative': float(surface_derivative),
135            'equivalent_control': float(u_eq),
136            'switching_control': float(u_switch),
137            'derivative_control': float(u_deriv),
138            'total_before_saturation': float(u_total),
139
140            # Status indicators
141            'saturation_active': abs(u_total) > self.config.max_force,
142            'in_boundary_layer': self._boundary_layer.is_in_boundary_layer(surface_value, surface_derivative),
143            'controller_type': 'classical_smc',
144
145            # Performance metrics
146            'control_effort': abs(u_final),
147            'surface_magnitude': abs(surface_value)
148        }
149
150    def _create_error_result(self, error_msg: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
151        """Create error result with safe defaults."""
152        return {
153            'u': 0.0,
154            'error': error_msg,
155            'controller_type': 'classical_smc',
156            'safe_mode': True
157        }
158
159    @property
160    def gains(self) -> List[float]:
161        """Return controller gains for interface compatibility."""
162        return list(self.config.gains)
163
164    def reset(self) -> None:
165        """Reset controller to initial state."""
166        # Reset any internal state variables if they exist
167        # Classical SMC typically doesn't have internal state to reset
168        # But we ensure any analysis components are reset
169        if hasattr(self._boundary_layer, 'reset'):
170            self._boundary_layer.reset()
171        if hasattr(self._surface, 'reset'):
172            self._surface.reset()
173
174    def get_parameters(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
175        """Get all controller parameters."""
176        return {
177            'gains': self.gains,
178            'config': self.config.to_dict(),
179            'surface_params': self._surface.get_coefficients(),
180            'boundary_layer_params': self._boundary_layer.get_parameters()
181        }
182
183    def analyze_performance(self, surface_history: List[float],
184                          control_history: List[float], dt: float = 0.01) -> Dict[str, Any]:
185        """Analyze controller performance."""
186        return self._boundary_layer.analyze_performance(surface_history, control_history, dt)
187
188
189# Backward compatibility facade
190class ClassicalSMC:
191    """Backward-compatible facade for the modular Classical SMC."""
192
193    def __init__(self, gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray], max_force: float,
194                 boundary_layer: float, dynamics_model: Optional[Any] = None, **kwargs):
195        """
196        Initialize Classical SMC with legacy interface.
197
198        Args:
199            gains: [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, K, kd]
200            max_force: Maximum control force
201            boundary_layer: Boundary layer thickness
202            dynamics_model: Optional dynamics model
203            **kwargs: Additional parameters
204        """
205        # Create modular configuration
206        config = ClassicalSMCConfig(
207            gains=list(gains),
208            max_force=max_force,
209            boundary_layer=boundary_layer,
210            dynamics_model=dynamics_model,
211            **kwargs
212        )
213
214        # Initialize modular controller
215        self._controller = ModularClassicalSMC(config)
216
217    def compute_control(self, state: np.ndarray, state_vars: Any, history: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
218        """Compute control (delegates to modular controller)."""
219        return self._controller.compute_control(state, state_vars, history)
220
221    @property
222    def gains(self) -> List[float]:
223        """Return controller gains."""
224        return self._controller.gains
225
226    def reset(self) -> None:
227        """Reset controller to initial state."""
228        self._controller.reset()
229
230    def get_parameters(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
231        """Get controller parameters."""
232        return self._controller.get_parameters()

ClassesÂ¶

ModularClassicalSMCÂ¶

Modular Classical SMC controller using composition of focused components.

Components:

  • Sliding surface: Computes s = Î»â‚Ä—â‚ + câ‚eâ‚ + Î»â‚‚Ä—â‚‚ + câ‚‚eâ‚‚

  • Equivalent control: Model-based u_eq = -(LMâ»Â¹B)â»Â¹LMâ»Â¹F

  • Boundary layer: Continuous switching with chattering reduction

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class ModularClassicalSMC:
  2    """
  3    Modular Classical SMC controller using composition of focused components.
  4
  5    Components:
  6    - Sliding surface: Computes s = Î»â‚Ä—â‚ + câ‚eâ‚ + Î»â‚‚Ä—â‚‚ + câ‚‚eâ‚‚
  7    - Equivalent control: Model-based u_eq = -(LMâ»Â¹B)â»Â¹LMâ»Â¹F
  8    - Boundary layer: Continuous switching with chattering reduction
  9    """
 10
 11    # Required for PSO optimization integration
 12    n_gains = 6  # [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, K, kd]
 13
 14    def __init__(self, config: ClassicalSMCConfig):
 15        """
 16        Initialize modular classical SMC.
 17
 18        Args:
 19            config: Type-safe configuration object
 20        """
 21        self.config = config
 22
 23        # Initialize components
 24        self._surface = LinearSlidingSurface(config.get_surface_gains())
 25        self._equivalent = EquivalentControl(
 26            dynamics_model=config.dynamics_model,
 27            regularization_alpha=config.regularization_alpha,
 28            min_regularization=config.min_regularization,
 29            max_condition_number=config.max_condition_number,
 30            use_fixed_regularization=not config.use_adaptive_regularization,
 31            controllability_threshold=config.get_effective_controllability_threshold()
 32        )
 33        self._boundary_layer = BoundaryLayer(
 34            thickness=config.boundary_layer,
 35            slope=config.boundary_layer_slope,
 36            switch_method=config.switch_method
 37        )
 38
 39        # Setup logging
 40        self.logger = logging.getLogger(self.__class__.__name__)
 41
 42    def compute_control(self, state: np.ndarray, state_vars: Any, history: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 43        """
 44        Compute classical SMC control law.
 45
 46        Args:
 47            state: System state [x, x_dot, theta1, theta1_dot, theta2, theta2_dot]
 48            state_vars: Controller internal state (for interface compatibility)
 49            history: Controller history (for interface compatibility)
 50
 51        Returns:
 52            Control result dictionary
 53        """
 54        try:
 55            # 1. Compute sliding surface
 56            surface_value = self._surface.compute(state)
 57
 58            # 2. Compute surface derivative (simplified)
 59            surface_derivative = self._estimate_surface_derivative(state)
 60
 61            # 3. Compute equivalent control (model-based feedforward)
 62            u_equivalent = self._equivalent.compute(state, self._surface, surface_derivative)
 63
 64            # 4. Compute switching control (robust feedback)
 65            u_switching = self._boundary_layer.compute_switching_control(
 66                surface_value, self.config.K, surface_derivative
 67            )
 68
 69            # 5. Compute derivative control (damping)
 70            u_derivative = self.config.kd * surface_derivative
 71
 72            # 6. Combine control components
 73            u_total = u_equivalent + u_switching + u_derivative
 74
 75            # 7. Apply saturation
 76            u_saturated = np.clip(u_total, -self.config.max_force, self.config.max_force)
 77
 78            # 8. Create result
 79            return self._create_control_result(
 80                u_saturated, surface_value, surface_derivative,
 81                u_equivalent, u_switching, u_derivative, u_total
 82            )
 83
 84        except Exception as e:
 85            self.logger.error(f"Control computation failed: {e}")
 86            return self._create_error_result(str(e))
 87
 88    def _estimate_surface_derivative(self, state: np.ndarray) -> float:
 89        """Estimate surface derivative for derivative control."""
 90        # Simplified derivative estimation
 91        # In full implementation, this would use dynamics model
 92        if len(state) >= 6:
 93            theta1_dot = state[3]
 94            theta2_dot = state[5]
 95            return self.config.lam1 * theta1_dot + self.config.lam2 * theta2_dot
 96        return 0.0
 97
 98    def _create_control_result(self, u_final: float, surface_value: float,
 99                             surface_derivative: float, u_eq: float,
100                             u_switch: float, u_deriv: float, u_total: float) -> Dict[str, Any]:
101        """Create structured control result."""
102        return {
103            # Main output
104            'u': float(u_final),
105
106            # Component breakdown
107            'surface_value': float(surface_value),
108            'surface_derivative': float(surface_derivative),
109            'equivalent_control': float(u_eq),
110            'switching_control': float(u_switch),
111            'derivative_control': float(u_deriv),
112            'total_before_saturation': float(u_total),
113
114            # Status indicators
115            'saturation_active': abs(u_total) > self.config.max_force,
116            'in_boundary_layer': self._boundary_layer.is_in_boundary_layer(surface_value, surface_derivative),
117            'controller_type': 'classical_smc',
118
119            # Performance metrics
120            'control_effort': abs(u_final),
121            'surface_magnitude': abs(surface_value)
122        }
123
124    def _create_error_result(self, error_msg: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
125        """Create error result with safe defaults."""
126        return {
127            'u': 0.0,
128            'error': error_msg,
129            'controller_type': 'classical_smc',
130            'safe_mode': True
131        }
132
133    @property
134    def gains(self) -> List[float]:
135        """Return controller gains for interface compatibility."""
136        return list(self.config.gains)
137
138    def reset(self) -> None:
139        """Reset controller to initial state."""
140        # Reset any internal state variables if they exist
141        # Classical SMC typically doesn't have internal state to reset
142        # But we ensure any analysis components are reset
143        if hasattr(self._boundary_layer, 'reset'):
144            self._boundary_layer.reset()
145        if hasattr(self._surface, 'reset'):
146            self._surface.reset()
147
148    def get_parameters(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
149        """Get all controller parameters."""
150        return {
151            'gains': self.gains,
152            'config': self.config.to_dict(),
153            'surface_params': self._surface.get_coefficients(),
154            'boundary_layer_params': self._boundary_layer.get_parameters()
155        }
156
157    def analyze_performance(self, surface_history: List[float],
158                          control_history: List[float], dt: float = 0.01) -> Dict[str, Any]:
159        """Analyze controller performance."""
160        return self._boundary_layer.analyze_performance(surface_history, control_history, dt)

ClassicalSMCÂ¶

Backward-compatible facade for the modular Classical SMC.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class ClassicalSMC:
 2    """Backward-compatible facade for the modular Classical SMC."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray], max_force: float,
 5                 boundary_layer: float, dynamics_model: Optional[Any] = None, **kwargs):
 6        """
 7        Initialize Classical SMC with legacy interface.
 8
 9        Args:
10            gains: [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, K, kd]
11            max_force: Maximum control force
12            boundary_layer: Boundary layer thickness
13            dynamics_model: Optional dynamics model
14            **kwargs: Additional parameters
15        """
16        # Create modular configuration
17        config = ClassicalSMCConfig(
18            gains=list(gains),
19            max_force=max_force,
20            boundary_layer=boundary_layer,
21            dynamics_model=dynamics_model,
22            **kwargs
23        )
24
25        # Initialize modular controller
26        self._controller = ModularClassicalSMC(config)
27
28    def compute_control(self, state: np.ndarray, state_vars: Any, history: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
29        """Compute control (delegates to modular controller)."""
30        return self._controller.compute_control(state, state_vars, history)
31
32    @property
33    def gains(self) -> List[float]:
34        """Return controller gains."""
35        return self._controller.gains
36
37    def reset(self) -> None:
38        """Reset controller to initial state."""
39        self._controller.reset()
40
41    def get_parameters(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
42        """Get controller parameters."""
43        return self._controller.get_parameters()
